channel.title: Posts on BOK
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on BOK

item.title: macOS Weather widget reborn
item.description: Ever since using Mac OS X for the first time, I’ve been a sucker for the Dashboard: pressing F4 on any Mac has become muscle memory over the last 14 years. Somewhere in the recent past Mac OS X was renamed to macOS and the F4 key was given a different function: Launchpad. And instead of Dashboard, we’re supposed to use Notifications… So Apple’s love for the Dashboard and its widgets had faded.

item.title: Pixiecore & waitron
item.description: A “small journey” into getting Google’s pixiecore to work with an API-server named waitron.

item.title: Server provisioning at Spindle
item.description: Previously published on the devhouse Spindle weblog, June 1st 2017.

item.title: Workshop: Python en Django in Docker
item.description: A manual (in Dutch) written for the local Docker Grunn Meetup, to become familiar with Docker & docker-compose, by setting up a small Python / Django app.

item.title: Hands-on: WordPress en MySQL op Docker
item.description: A manual (in Dutch) written for the local Docker Grunn Meetup, to become familiar with Docker & Compose by setting up a WordPress-blog.

item.title: Apple - Gramps Added to the Family
item.description: “Our” Apple-family welcomed a rather old guy this weekend, a Power Macintosh G4, the one with AGP and gigabit ethernet. Thanks to EveryMac for pointing me how to differentiate between models.

item.title: IPv6 working. Now what..?
item.description: Over the last couple of weeks this blog hasn’t had a proper post. Instead it was filled by automagically created Twitter updates. In the meantime lots of things happened: too much to write down here. Instead I’ll focus on my (re-)achievements with IPv6.

item.title: Review - Tomato Firmware for WRT54G
item.description: I could not resist my curiousity, so that is why I decided to install third-party firmware named Tomato (version 0.03.0747 to be specific) on my brand new Linksys WRT54GL v1.1 wireless LAN-router.
